task: Create a real-time chat system using a library that supports asynchronous communication.
code:
```ruby
require 'async'
require 'async/websocket'
require 'json'

class ChatServer
  def initialize
    @clients = []
  end

  def broadcast(message, exclude_client = nil)
    @clients.each do |client|
      next if client == exclude_client
      client.async.send_text(message)
    end
  end

  def run
    Async do |task|
      Async::Reactor.run do |reactor|
        endpoint = Async::IO::Endpoint.tcp('0.0.0.0', 8080)
        endpoint.accept do |socket|
          client_task = reactor.async do
            client = Async::WebSocket::Client.new(socket)

            @clients << client

            while message = client.read
              broadcast(message, client)
            end

            @clients.delete(client)
          end

          client_task.wait
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

server = ChatServer.new
server.run
```

Create a to-do list application that stores data locally using a library for file management.
code:
```ruby
require 'json'

class TodoList
  FILE_NAME = 'todo_list.json'

  def initialize
    @todos = load_todos
  end

  def add_task(task)
    @todos << { task: task, completed: false }
    save_todos
  end

  def complete_task(index)
    @todos[index][:completed] = true if @todos[index]
    save_todos
  end

  def list_tasks
    @todos.each_with_index do |todo, index|
      status = todo[:completed] ? 'Completed' : 'Pending'
      puts "#{index + 1}. [#{status}] #{todo[:task]}"
    end
  end

  private

  def load_todos
    if File.exist?(FILE_NAME)
      JSON.parse(File.read(FILE_NAME), symbolize_names: true)
    else
      []
    end
  end

  def save_todos
    File.write(FILE_NAME, JSON.pretty_generate(@todos))
  end
end
```

task: Build a simulation that models fluid dynamics using a library for physics simulations.
code:
```ruby
require 'chipmunk'

# Initialize the Chipmunk space for the simulation
space = CP::Space.new
space.gravity = CP::Vec2.new(0, -9.8)

# Create a fluid particle class
class FluidParticle
  attr_accessor :body, :shape

  def initialize(x, y)
    mass = 1.0
    radius = 5.0
    moment_of_inertia = CP.moment_for_circle(mass, 0, radius, CP::Vec2.new(0, 0))
    @body = CP::Body.new(mass, moment_of_inertia)
    @body.p = CP::Vec2.new(x, y)
    @shape = CP::Shape::Circle.new(@body, radius, CP::Vec2.new(0, 0))
    @shape.collision_type = :fluid_particle
  end
end

# Add boundaries for the simulation
def add_boundary(space, start_point, end_point)
  static_body = space.static_body
  shape = CP::Shape::Segment.new(static_body, start_point, end_point, 0.0)
  shape.e = 0.8 # elasticity

add_boundary(space, CP::Vec2.new(640, 0), CP::Vec2.new(640, 480))
add_boundary(space, CP::Vec2.new(0, 480), CP::Vec2.new(640, 480))

# Create and add fluid particles to the space
particles = []
100.times do |i|
  particle = FluidParticle.new(rand(100..540), rand(300..450))
  particles << particle
  space.add_body(particle.body)
  space.add_shape(particle.shape)
```

task: Create an email client that uses a library for IMAP and POP3 communication.
code:
```ruby
require 'net/imap'
require 'net/pop'

class EmailClient
  def initialize(imap_settings, pop_settings)
    @imap_settings = imap_settings
    @pop_settings = pop_settings
  end

  def fetch_emails_with_imap
    imap = Net::IMAP.new(@imap_settings[:server], @imap_settings[:port], @imap_settings[:ssl])
    imap.login(@imap_settings[:username], @imap_settings[:password])
    imap.select('INBOX')
    emails = imap.search(['ALL']).map do |message_id|
      imap.fetch(message_id, 'RFC822')[0].attr['RFC822']
    end
    imap.logout
    imap.disconnect
    emails
  end

  def fetch_emails_with_pop
    pop = Net::POP3.new(@pop_settings[:server], @pop_settings[:port])
    pop.enable_ssl if @pop_settings[:ssl]
    pop.start(@pop_settings[:username], @pop_settings[:password])
    emails = if pop.mails.empty?
               []
             else
               pop.mails.map do |mail|
                 mail.pop
               end
             end
    pop.finish
    emails
  end
end
```

task: Implement a program that manages user authentication and authorization using a security library.
code:
```ruby
require 'bcrypt'
require 'jwt'

class User
  attr_accessor :username, :password_hash, :roles

  def initialize(username, password, roles = [])
    @username = username
    @password_hash = BCrypt::Password.create(password)
    @roles = roles
  end

  def authenticate(password)
    BCrypt::Password.new(@password_hash) == password
  end

  def generate_token
    payload = { username: @username, roles: @roles }
    JWT.encode(payload, 'my_secret', 'HS256')
  end
end

class AuthManager
  def initialize
    @users = []
  end

  def add_user(username, password, roles = [])
    @users << User.new(username, password, roles)
  end

  def authenticate_user(username, password)
    user = @users.find { |u| u.username == username }
    user && user.authenticate(password) ? user.generate_token : nil
  end

  def authorize_user(token, required_role)
    decoded_token = JWT.decode(token, 'my_secret', true, { algorithm: 'HS256' })
    user_data = decoded_token[0]
    user_data['roles'].include?(required_role)
  rescue JWT::DecodeError
    false
  end
end

auth_manager.add_user('john_doe', 'password123', ['admin'])
```

task: Write a program that compresses and decompresses data using a data compression library.
code:
```ruby
require 'zlib'

def compress(data)
  Zlib::Deflate.deflate(data)
end

def decompress(compressed_data)
  Zlib::Inflate.inflate(compressed_data)
end

# Example usage
data = "This is a test string to be compressed and decompressed."
compressed_data = compress(data)
puts "Compressed: #{compressed_data}"
decompressed_data = decompress(compressed_data)
puts "Decompressed: #{decompressed_data}"
```
